item.title: Lara Croft is Going Mad! (Game Fails #437)
item.description: A special collection of fails from Tomb Raider games is featured.

item.title: Monopoly GO: How to Get Mr. Monopoly’s Cat Board Token
item.description:
Collectibles make all the difference in Monopoly GO . These unique tokens, shields, dice skins, and emojis transform the simple board game into a more personalized experience. You can get new collectibles every now and then by engaging in Partner Events, Tycoon Racers, Treasure Hunts, and by finishing seasonal sticker albums. The latest board token up for grabs is the limited-edition Mr. Monopoly Cat token. If you want to add this token to your Monopoly GO shelves, read on.

How To Get Mr. Monopoly’s Cat Token in Monopoly GO

The adorable Mr. Monopoly’s Cat token features a white, cartoon-style cat sitting regally in a plush chair. The cat’s wearing a small top hat, much like the one Mr. M regularly wears. Not only that, but there’s a gold monocle on a gold chain, worn over the cat's right eye, giving it a completely regal look.

If you want to add a touch of refined elegance to your Monopoly GO board with Mr. Monopoly's Cat, you'll need to achieve the required milestones within the current Tycoon Pass. This feature is accessible through Monopoly GO 's Tycoon Club. You can hit the milestones in the Tycoon Pass by spending Diamonds in the Tycoon Club Store.

Your path to Mr. Monopoly's Cat starts with spending 300 Diamonds on items like sticker packs and safes in the Tycoon Club's Benefits section. Remember, you can only get Diamonds (or Loyalty Points) with real money.

The current Tycoon Pass season in Monopoly GO , which features Mr. Monopoly's Cat token will run until late April 2025. Once the season resets, you'll no longer be able to get this token. With a limited timeframe, make sure to actively participate in the Tycoon Club and spend your Diamonds to progress through the milestones before time runs out.

All Monopoly GO Tycoon Pass Rewards

This Tycoon Pass season offers seven distinct milestones, each loaded with valuable rewards. Players can win a bunch of prizes, including dice rolls, sticker packs of different rarities, and the highly sought-after Wild Sticker.

The following table breaks down all the milestones and rewards in the ongoing Tycoon Pass in Monopoly GO ’s Tycoon Club.

Milestone

Reward

#1

25 Dice Rolls, Yellow Sticker Pack

#2

100 Dice Rolls, Cash, Pink Sticker Pack

#3

250 Dice Rolls, Cash, Pink Sticker Pack

#4

750 Dice Rolls, Cash, Blue Sticker Pack

#5

1,500 Dice Rolls, Cash, Swap Pack

#6

Mr. Monopoly’s Cat board token

#7

Wild Sticker

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail – Mydei Team Composition Guide
item.description:
Mydei

Imaginary

Destruction

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Level-Up Materials

Team Composition

Best Light Cone

Back to All Characters

Mydei is a newly introduced Imaginary Destruction unit who becomes playable during the Amphoreus region storyline in Honkai: Star Rail . While he shares the same Path and Element as Imbibitor Lunae, Mydei sets himself apart with mechanics that emphasize self-sustained HP loss and regeneration— similar to Blade . This unique playstyle enables him to amplify his damage output without relying heavily on skill point management .

Thanks to his versatile kit, Mydei benefits greatly from support and sustain units but doesn’t strictly require a sub-DPS to function effectively. However, certain characters naturally synergize better with him than others. In general, Mydei performs best with teammates who provide buffs to stats like HP, Crit Rate, Crit DMG, or overall DMG. Characters capable of applying universal buffs or debuffs, such as RES Pen, can also be invaluable in boosting his damage potential. Additionally, because Mydei thrives on taking frequent actions and maximizing the use of his Ultimate, units that can enable this—whether through energy regeneration or turn manipulation—can elevate his performance further. Below are some of Mydei’s optimal team compositions, catering to both F2P players and those with access to premium characters:

Mydei + Sunday + Tribbie + Luocha

Mydei Premium Team

Mydei can excel with a variety of support units, but the combination of Sunday and Tribbie stands out as his optimal team setup . Since Mydei doesn’t rely on ATK or follow-up DMG buffs provided by characters like Robin, these units can be reserved for other team compositions. Skill point management remains a key consideration, though not enough to necessitate Sparkle , as Mydei prioritizes using his Skill over his Basic Attack during his turns.

Sunday is an excellent support for Mydei, as he is skill point neutral and can advance Mydei’s turn order with his Skill while boosting his DMG and Crit Rate. Additionally, Sunday’s Ultimate provides a Crit DMG buff and restores energy for Mydei, making him an ideal choice for maximizing his damage potential.

Tribbie complements this setup perfectly. She scales with HP and offers universal buffs like RES Pen with her Skill and increased enemy DMG taken when her Ultimate zone is active. Furthermore, Tribbie’s DMG benefits from the combined HP of the team due to her bonus ability, making a synergy with Mydei’s HP-scaling mechanics especially valuable for increasing her own damage output. If players equip Tribbie with Dance! Dance! Dance! (DDD) light cone, she will also be able to advance forward all allies, which will be quite valuable in Mydei's team comps since he prefers having high SPD.

For the healer slot, players have great flexibility. Any sustain unit works well with Mydei, but healers are particularly effective. Premium options like Luocha are highly recommended, as his skill point-positive nature and powerful overhealing capabilities make him an excellent fit for Mydei’s team. He will also be able to dispell debuffs from the team, while also dispelling buffs from the enemies which will come particularly useful in content where enemy might be buffing themselves significantly. Conversely, units like Lingsha or Huohuo might be better suited for FuA, Break-oriented, or ATK-scaling teams, leaving Luocha as the preferable choice for Mydei’s sustain. Nevertheless if players have no access to Luocha, they will also work wonderfully, or even F2P units like Lynx will benefit him.

Team Roles

  • Mydei: Main DPS
  • Sunday: Support, buffer, advance action, battery
  • Tribbie: Support, buffer, debuffer, advance action (with DDD equipped)
  • Luocha: Healer, support

Mydei + Remembrance Trailblazer + Pela + Lynx

Mydei F2P Team

Going fully F2P with Mydei is absolutely a viable and competitive option. While premium units like Sunday have stronger synergy with Mydei, the Remembrance Trailblazer stands out as an excellent F2P alternative. They provide valuable team-wide buffs such as increased Crit DMG, action advancement, and the ability for Mydei to deal True DMG—enhancing his overall effectiveness.

Another great F2P choice is Pela . Like Luocha, she can dispel buffs from enemies while inflicting DEF Shred or other debuffs, depending on her equipped Light Cone. Pela’s skill point-friendly nature makes her an ideal companion , as she allows Mydei to prioritize his Skill usage without putting a strain on skill-point-management.

For sustain, Lynx is a fantastic F2P option with surprising synergy for Mydei. Not only does Lynx offer team-wide cleansing and solid healing , but she also enhances Mydei’s survivability and damage potential. Her ability to increase the aggro of Destruction and Preservation path units allows enemies to target Mydei more frequently. Additionally, her Skill can apply Survival Response , which boosts Mydei’s Max HP among other things—further amplifying his damage scaling and survivability. Players with access to Lynx's sixth Eidolon will find the HP increasing effect to be even more potent, elevating her to a level comparable to premium sustain units in Mydei’s team compositions.

Team Roles

  • Mydei: Main DPS
  • RMC: Sub-DPS (True DMG), buffer, advance action
  • Pela: Support, debuffer
  • Luocha: Healer, support, buffer

item.title: Stardew Valley Player Encounters Secret at Perfect Time
item.description:
Summary

  • Stardew Valley has hidden secrets, including a pot of gold found by a surprised player on Spring 17.
  • Players can click on the pot for rewards, which increase yearly up to 2500 gold by year 93 in-game.
  • The discovery coincided with St. Patrick's Day, showcasing the game's equivalence to real-world holidays.

A Stardew Valley player is sharing that they discovered a pot of gold in the game at a perfect time. The find has surprised some players who didn't know that it existed in Stardew Valley , while others are amused by the synchronicity.

Stardew Valley has a good number of secrets hidden away in it, with some having special limited triggers for appearing. Some of these secrets go unnoticed by players for a long time, and developer ConcernedApe tends to add more whenever a major content patch is released for Stardew Valley . As a result, players end up sharing the discoveries that they make, but it's rare for them to match with real-world timing.

On the Stardew Valley subreddit, user ProblemSpecific7516 shared their surprise at discovering a pot of gold in the game. The pot of gold, when clicked on, rewarded the player with a small gold reward and a Leprechaun Hat , and took them by surprise, as they'd already played the game for roughly 400 hours before encountering this little detail. While some other players knew about it, it seems that many had missed it, as the pot of gold only shows up on Spring 17. What makes this find so perfect is that the player discovered it on St. Patrick's Day in the real world.

Stardew Valley Players Share Pot of Gold Discovery Amusement

Many fans have been surprised by this find, but those who already knew about it pointed out how perfect it is that the player found it when they did. While Stardew Valley doesn't have the same holidays as the real world, it has several equivalents, like The Feast of the Winter Star being its equivalent of Christmas, or Spirit's Eve being its Halloween. St. Patrick's Day is the same way, with this little detail being a nod to the March 17 holiday, landing on the closest equivalent possible with the game's four-season calendar: Spring 17.

Those who didn't know about the pot of gold may want to know more. Players can find it by looking for the waterfall near the abandoned building that becomes a hat shop run by a mouse. After the initial reward of the Leprechaun Hat and 200 gold, the player can revisit it annually to get a repeat gold prize plus 25 gold for each year that's passed in the game. This ultimately caps out at 2500 in year 93. Players in their first year of the game should especially take care to not miss out, as it's a good opportunity to get a little extra cash when money is still hard to come by in the game.

item.title: Diablo 4 Releases New Update for March 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • Diablo 4 receives a small but crucial update with bug fixes and new features like resolution scaling.
  • Blizzard introduces support for Intel XeLL and XeSS Frame Generation.

Just after the end of Diablo 4 's Season 8 Public Test Realm, Blizzard has released the 2.1.4 update for the live game. The latest Diablo 4 update is a small but important one, bringing some bug fixes as well as a couple of interesting additions.

Diablo 4 has already received plenty of patches this year, with Blizzard continuing to maintain its premier action RPG. The game currently follows a seasonal model, with massive content drops every few months to keep players entertained and coming back for more. Diablo 4 's Season 8 PTR was live between March 11 and March 18, giving players a chance to test all the gameplay changes coming in the next Season. Early responses indicate that Season 8 will make leveling much slower, although this could change based on feedback between now and Season 8's April 29 release date.

Blizzard released the latest Diablo 4 patch notes on its website, confirming some interesting changes. Notably, support for Intel XeLL and XeSS Frame Generation is now live for players who meet the Diablo 4 hardware requirements , and resolution scaling will now be enabled in the game's settings for better performance. Players can still manually disable this if they'd like. The new Intel XeLL and XeSS Frame Generation features can be found in the game's graphics settings for players who want to test them out.

The rest of the update features some miscellaneous bug fixes, largely focused on Diablo 4 's Season of Witchcraft update. The Season of Witchcraft still has quite a lot of life left in it, after Blizzard delayed the release of Season 8 until April 29. While the latest update may not be the most significant patch Diablo 4 players have ever seen, it's better to have the fixes than not.

The future is bright for Diablo 4 , with Blizzard seemingly committed to the game for a long time to come. After all, the developer is even still releasing updates for Diablo 3 , so it's fair to believe its sequel will receive a similar level of support. Looking ahead to the near future, Blizzard recently revealed difficulty changes for Diablo 4 's Season 8, confirming that the plan is for the game to become more difficult going forward amid concerns it's currently too easy. It'll be exciting to see what else Season 8 has in store for players when it launches on April 29.

Diablo 4 Update 2.1.4 Patch Notes (March 18)

Game Updates

  • Support for Intel XeLL and XeSS Frame Generation has been added. Settings can be found in the graphics menu for players on PC who meet the hardware requirements.
  • By default, Diablo IV will now enable resolution scaling for better performance. The scaling method chosen will be based on the user's hardware configuration.

Bug Fixes

  • Season of Witchcraft
    • Fixed an issue where the Scour event could not be completed in certain situations.
    • Fixed an issue where the icons on the minimap for Herb nodes could disappear during the Scour event.
    • Fixed an issue where Treasure Goblins could be hard to hear in Headhunt zones.
    • Fixed an issue where Cocoons could destroy Druid Boulder projectiles.

  • Miscellaneous
    • Fixed an issue where Inquisitors could teleport to towns in certain scenarios.
    • Fixed an issue where the ability to rename a loadout could be lost when disabling the Mature Language Filter.
    • Various performance, stability, and visual improvements.
